data.title: Legals for April, 3 2020
data.text:
SUMMONS FEE: EXEMPT (Idaho Code ยง 67-2301) LAWRENCE G. WASDEN ATTORNEY GENERAL STATE OF IDAHO NICOLE S. MCKAY, ISB# 4593 CHIEF, HEALTH & HUMAN SERVICES DIVISION DENISE L. ROSEN, ISB# 4163 Deputy Attorney General 1120 Ironwood Drive Coeur d'Alene, ID 83814 Denise.Rosen@dhw.idaho.gov Telephone: (208) 769-1589 IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE FIRST JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF THE STATE OF IDAHO, IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OF KOOTENAI IN THE MATTER OF: BABY BOY NEFF DOB: 06/22/2019 A Child Under Eighteen Years. IN THE MATTER OF THE TERMINATION OF THE PARENTAL RIGHTS OF: REBECCA MAE WHIPPLE, Mother Case No. CV28-19-4586 THE STATE OF IDAHO SENDS GREETINGS TO: REBECCA MAE WHIPPLE YOU ARE HEREBY NOTIFIED that a Petition to Terminate Parental Rights between BABY BOY NEFF and his mother, REBECCA MAE WHIPPLE, has been filed with the District Court of the County of Kootenai, by Denise L. Rosen, Deputy Attorney General, under Idaho Code Section 16-2005, etc. A hearing on the petition will be held at the Juvenile Justice Center, 205 North 4th Street, Coeur d'Alene, Idaho on June 2, 2020, at 9:30 a.m. or as soon thereafter as counsel may be heard. YOU ARE FURTHER NOTIFIED that you are entitled to be represented by an Attorney. If you cannot afford one, you may be appointed an Attorney by making application to the Court at the Kootenai County Courthouse. If you fail to appear at the time and place set forth above, or fail to appear through an attorney, you may be deemed to have defaulted and a judgment terminating your parental rights may be entered without further hearing or notice. DATED this11th day of February, 2020. CLERK OF THE DISTRICT COURT KOOTENAI COUNTY, IDAHO BY: /s/Theresa Carroll DEPUTY CDA LEGAL 3368 AD#373339 MARCH 27, APRIL 3, 10, 2020

BONNER COUNTY EMERGENCY MEDICAL SERVICES PONDERAY SATELLITE EMS FACILITY EXTENSION NOTICE OF ADVERTISEMENT FOR BID Sealed Bids will be received by Bonner County at the office of the County Commissioners of said County on or before the 24th day of April, 2020, until the hour of 9:00 a.m. for the Ponderay Satellite EMS Facility Project. Bids shall be hand delivered or mailed to the Office of County Commissioners, located at 1500 Highway 2, Suite 308, Sandpoint, ID 83864. Envelopes shall be clearly marked "Bid Enclosed - Ponderay Satellite EMS Facility Project". Bids received will be opened and read aloud in the Commissioner's Office by an appointed Bonner County official. Late bids will not be considered. The project consists of providing Bonner County EMS with a completed, ready for occupancy,1,440 square foot EMS building, including installation of associated utilities and site improvements to be located at Lot 2, B&L Commercial Park, Ponderay. As part of the project it will be necessary for the Contractor to provide design-build electrical, mechanical and plumbing designs. Pre-Bid Conference shall be March 25th at 12pm PST at the project site, located at the southwest corner of the intersection of Kootenai Cutoff Road and Moody Lane. Bid forms, bidder's instructions, plans and specifications, and contract forms may be examined at the following locations: * Bonner County Public Works Office, 1500 Hwy 2, Suite 101, Sandpoint, ID 83864, Phone 208-255-5681. Copies may be obtained at the Public Works Office. The standard set of contract documents includes the project drawings. All bids shall contain one of the following forms of bidder's security in an amount equal to 5% of the amount bid: (a) Cash, (b) Cashier's Check made payable to the County, (c) Certified Check made payable to the County, or (d) bidder's bond executed by a qualified Idaho Surety Company, made payable to the County. Bids will remain subject to acceptance for 45 days after the bid opening. Davis-Bacon Wage Rates will not be applicable to this project. The right is reserved to reject any or all Bids. Dated this 10th day of March 2020. /s/ Jeff Lindsey, EMS Director CDA LEGAL 3343 AD#372690 APRIL 3, 10, 2020

PUBLIC NOTICE CNS-3357389# In accordance with Sec. 106 of the Programmatic Agreement, AT&T plans a 90' monopole at 215 W. ANTON AVE., COEUR D'ALENE, ID 83815. Please direct comments to Gavin L. at 818-898-4866 regarding site SP4384. CDA LEGAL 3384 AD#374843 APRIL 3, 4, 2020

NOTICE TO CREDITORS IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE FIRST JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF THE STATE OF IDAHO, IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OF KOOTENAI IN THE MATTER OF THE ESTATE OF: RALPH HERBERT KLEI, JR. Date of Death: 11/25/19 CASE NO. CV28-20-1441 NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that the undersigned has been appointed Personal Representative of the estate of the above-named decedent. All persons having claims against the decedent or the estate are required to present their claims within four months after the date of the first publication of this Notice or said claims will be forever barred. Claims must be presented to the undersigned at the address indicated, and filed with the Clerk of the Court. DATED: March 19, 2020 /s/ Paul Klei Personal Representative c/o Pamela Massey Callahan & Associates, Chtd. PO Box 2226 Coeur d'Alene, ID 83816 CDA LEGAL 3367 AD#373336 MARCH 27, APRIL 3, 10, 2020

NOTICE TO CREDITORS (I.C. 15-3-801) IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE FIRST JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF THE STATE OF IDAHO, IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OF KOOTENAI MAGISTRATE DIVISION In the Matter of the Estate of CORWIN PETER HEDSTROM, Deceased. Case No. CV28-19-8460 NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN that Nichole Hedstrom has been appointed as the Personal Representative of the estate of the above-named decedent. All persons having claims against the decedent or the estate are required to present their claims within four months after the date of the first publication of this Notice or said claims will be forever barred. Claims must be presented to the undersigned at the address indicated above, and filed with the Clerk of Court. DATED this 3rd day of March, 2020. HOLT LAW OFFICE, PLLC By: /s/ Kevin P. Holt Attorney for Personal Representative CDA LEGAL 3366 AD#373328 MARCH 27, APRIL 3, 10, 2020

NOTICE OF MINOR SUBDIVISION APPLICATION AND PUBLIC COMMENT PERIOD NOTICE IS HEREBY GIVEN for the application of a Minor Subdivision in Case No. MIN20-0021, Rice Estates, a request by Michael and Stacia Lyden Living Trust for a two (2) lot minor subdivision on approximately 10.088 gross acres in the Rural zone. The parcel number is 53N04W-26-7700, described as: The Southeast Quarter of the Northeast Quarter of the Southeast Quarter of Section 26, Township 53 North, Range 04 West, Boise Meridian, Kootenai County, State of Idaho. The subject parcel is located along N Weir Rd., a public road maintained by Lakes Highway District, approximately 0.3 miles north of the intersection between N Weir Rd. and Brunner Rd. The proposed lots will each exceed the minimum lot size of 5.00 acres when gross acreage is used to calculate the size. Lot 1 will be 4.817 net acres, while Lot 2 will be 4.816 net acres. The public comment period for this application will begin on April 3, 2020 and end on May 3, 2020. Submit comments to or request information from Kootenai County Community Development, 451 N Government Way, P.O. Box 9000, Coeur d'Alene, ID 83816-9000, (208) 446-1070. CDA LEGAL 3389 AD#375046 APRIL 3, 2020

SUMMONS To: CHRISTINE STENSLAND You have been sued by DIONYSUS FINANCE, LLC dba, ADVANCE FINANCIAL, the Plaintiff, in the FIRST District Court in and for KOOTENAI COUNTY, Idaho, Case No. CV28-19-3837. The nature of the claim against you is collection of money owed by you. Any time after 21 days following the last publication of this summons, the court may enter a judgment against you without further notice, unless prior to that time you have filed a written response in the proper form, including the Case No., and paid any required filing fee to the Clerk of the Court at 501 Government Way, Coeur d'Alene, ID, telephone (208) 466-1160, and served a copy of your response on the Plaintiff's attorney MICHAEL J. ARCHIBALD, #8476 at M2 Law Group PC, P.O. Box 330, Meridian, ID 83680, telephone (208) 336-3331. A copy of the Summons and Complaint can be obtained by contacting either the Clerk of the Court or the attorney for Plaintiff. If you wish legal assistance, you should immediately retain an attorney to advise you in this matter. Dated: March 12, 2020 JIM BRANNON KOOTENAI COUNTY District Court By /s/ Susan McCoy Deputy CDA LEGAL 3328 AD#372064 MARCH 20, 27, APRIL 3, 10, 2020

NOTICE TO CREDITORS IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE FIRST JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF THE STATE OF IDAHO, IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OF KOOTENAI IN THE MATTER OF THE ESTATE OF AMOS BRUCE FERGUSON, Deceased. Claims must either be presented to the undersigned at the address indicated below or be filed with the Clerk of the Court. DATED this 23 day of March, 2020. /s/Michelle L. Ward, Personal Representative c/o Mark A. Jackson 114 E. Wallace Ave. Coeur d'Alene, ID 83814 CDA LEGAL 3359 AD#373130 MARCH 27, APRIL 3, 10, 2020

NOTICE TO CREDITORS IN THE DISTRICT COURT OF THE FIRST JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF THE STATE OF IDAHO, IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OF KOOTENAI IN THE MATTER OF THE ESTATE OF GEORGE GEOGA COCEA DECEASED. NOTICE OF HEARING ON NAME CHANGE (Minors) IN THE DISTRICT COURT FOR THE FIRST JUDICIAL DISTRICT FOR THE STATE OF IDAHO, IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OF KOOTENAI IN RE: JULES ARIETTA MOLETTE CHARLES JULIAN MOLETTE CASE NO. CV-28-20-2038 A Petition to change the name of (1) Jules Arietta Molettte, and the name of (2) Charles Julian Molette, now residing in the City of Dalton Gardens, State of Idaho, has been filed in the District Court in Kootenai County, Idaho. The name will change to (1) Jules Arietta Smith; (2) Charles Julian Smith. The reason for the change in name is: Personal Preference. A hearing on the petition is scheduled for 1:30 o'clock p.m. on May 4, 2020, at the Kootenai County Courthouse. Objections may be filed by any person who can show the court a good reason against the name change. Date: March 16, 2020 JIM BRANNON, CLERK OF THE DISTRICT COURT By: /s/ Bobee Deglman Deputy Clerk CDA LEGAL 3329 AD#372085 MARCH 20, 27, APRIL 3, 10, 2020

SUMMONS By Publication TO: Jason Tyree You have been sued by Shoshoni Dimberg the Petitioner in the District Court in and for Kootenai County. Idaho Case No. CV28-19-932. The nature of the claim against you is Divorce. Any time after 21 days following the last publication of this Summons, the court may enter a judgment against you without further notice, unless prior to that time you have filed a written response in the proper form, including the case number, and paid any required filing fee to the Clerk of the Court at (mailing address, physical address (if different from the mailing addres) and telephone number of the district court clerk) and served a copy of your response on the other party, whose mailing address and telephone number are 409 W. 21st Ave, Post Falls, Idaho 83854. 208-763-8020. A copy of the Summons and Petion/Motion can be obtained by contacting either the Clerk of the Court or the other party. If you wish legal assistance, you should immediately retain an attorney to advise you in this matter. Date: March 25, 2020 Kootenai County District Court By: /s/ Susan McCoy CDA LEGAL 3392 AD#375089 APRIL 3, 10, 17, 24, 2020

LEGAL NOTICE Community Action Partnership is applying for a USDA Rural Development Section 533, Housing Preservation Grant (HPG). These funds will be used to address health and safety hazards and rehabilitation concerns in existing rural homes and multi-family projects with very low and low income tenants. The areas of impact will be through Idaho's Region I and II which includes Boundary, Bonner, Benewah, Kootenai, Shoshone, Latah, Nez Perce, Lewis, Idaho and Clearwater Counties. For information of a technical nature, please contact Mark Fleming at (208) 764- 3351, Community Action Partnership, 124 New 6th Street, Lewiston, ID 83501. Submission of written comments: Anyone may submit written comments regarding this proposed use of this grant. All written comments must be submitted within 30 days of this notice. Comments should be address to M. Christine Fisher, Area Director, United States Department of Agriculture, Rural Development, 7830 Meadowlark Way #C-3, Coeur d'Alene, ID 83815, Christine.fisher@usda.gov. or Mark Fleming, Housing Program Director, Community Action Partnership, 124 New 6th Street, Lewiston, ID 83801, m.fleming@cap4action.org Community Action Partnership is a catalyst for building relationships that inspire and equip people to end poverty in our community. This institution is an equal opportunity provider CDA LEGAL 3393 AD#375271 APRIL 3, 2020

SUMMONS FOR SERVICE BY PUBLICATION IN THE DISTRICT COURT FOR THE FIRST JUDICIAL DISTRICT OF THE STATE OF IDAHO, IN AND FOR THE COUNTY OF KOOTENAI BELMONT, LLC, an Idaho limitedLiability company Plaintiff, v. WOODLAND SHORES, INC., a dissolved Idaho corporation; WOODLAND PARK, INC, an Idaho corporation; WOODLAND SHORES WATER AND SEWER ASSOCIATION, INC., an Idaho corporation; and JOHN and JANE DOES I through X, including ANY AND ALL PERSONS KNOWN OR UNKNOWN having any claim to or interest whatsoever in the following-described parcel of property: Lot 9, Block 1, WOODLAND SHORES SECOND ADDITION, County of Kootenai, State of Idaho, according to the official plat thereof recorded in Book F of Plats at Page 296, records of Kootenai County, Idaho, EXCEPTING THEREFROM THAT portion conveyed to the Worley Highway District in a deed recorded October 5, 2004 as Instrument No. 1904860, records of Kootenai County, Idaho. Defendants. Case No. CV28-20-1834 TO: JOHN and JANE DOES I through X, including ANY AND ALL PERSONS KNOWN OR UNKNOWN having any claim to or interest whatsoever in the following-described parcel of property. You have been sued by BELMONT, LLC, an Idaho limited liability company, the Plaintiff in the above mentioned case. The nature of the claim against you is to quiet title to the following real property: Lot 9, Block 1, WOODLAND SHORES SECOND ADDITION, County of Kootenai, State of Idaho, according to the official plat thereof recorded in Book F of Plats at Page 296, records of Kootenai County, Idaho, EXCEPTING THEREFROM THAT portion conveyed to the Worley Highway District in a deed recorded October 5, 2004 as Instrument No. 1904860, records of Kootenai County, Idaho. The Plaintiff in this case is seeking to quiet title to the subject property, and reserves the right to seek attorneys' fees in prosecuting this matter if judgment is taken by default, or in the event of contest, as set by this Court, together with Plaintiff's costs and disbursements incurred herein. Any time after twenty (21) days following the last publication of this Summons, the court may enter a judgment against you without further notice, unless prior to that time you have filed a written response in the proper form, including the case number, and paid any required filing fee to the Clerk of the Court at 324 W Garden Ave, Coeur d'Alene, Idaho 83814, and served a copy of your response on counsel for the Plaintiff, whose mailing address and telephone number are: Witherspoon, Kelley, c/o William C. Lenz, 422 W. Riverside Ave., Ste. 1100, Spokane, WA 99201, telephone no. (509) 624-5265. A copy of the Summons and Complaint for Quiet Title can be obtained by contacting either the Clerk of the Court or counsel for the Plaintiffs. If you wish legal assistance, you should immediately retain an attorney to advise you in this matter. DATED: March 9, 2020 KOOTENAI COUNTY DISTRICT COURT CLERK By:/s/ Susan McCoy Deputy CDA LEGAL 3289 AD#371061 MARCH 13, 20, 27, APRIL 3, 2020
